1.brief: the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
evenness, i.e. (figuratively) prosperity or concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) rectitude (only in plural with singular sense; often adverbially)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

2.brief: meaning accession (used as an adverb or conjunction); also or yea; adversatively though
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally)

3.brief: to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
the belly, especially the womb; also the bosom or body of anything
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

4.brief: heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
resemblance; concretely, model, shape; adverbially, like
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to close (the lips or ears); by analology to contract (a window by bevelled jambs)
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)

5.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
to whisper; by implication, to mumble aspell (as a magician)
to join (literally or figuratively); specifically (by means of spells) to fascinate
to be wise (in mind, word or act)

6.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
a village (as covered in by walls); also a young lion (perhaps as covered with a mane)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

7.brief: a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to cut short, i.e. curtail (specifically the prepuce, i.e. to circumcise); by implication, to blunt; figuratively, to destroy

8.brief: a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
a snail (as if floating in its own slime)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement

9.brief: properly, non-occurrence; used adverbially, not yet or before
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a pot; also a thorn (as springing up rapidly); by implication, a hook
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to storm; by implication, to shiver, i.e. fear

10.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)
to lave (the whole or a part of a thing)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
